meanings.definition: A large, shapeless mass or lump
meanings.sent1: The artist sculpted the clay into glops to create a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent2: She found glops of paint on her canvas after a messy painting session.
meanings.sent3: The toddler giggled as he squished the playdough into glops.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered into dark glops, ready to burst with rain.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully measured out glops of dough for the cookies.

meanings.definition: To form into a shapeless mass or lump
meanings.sent1: She glops the clay together to make a new shape.
meanings.sent2: The mud glops together when it rains heavily.
meanings.sent3: He glops the ingredients in the bowl, mixing them with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The artist glops the colors on the canvas, creating a beautiful abstract painting.
meanings.sent5: The children glop the sand into various shapes at the beach.

meanings.definition: To eat or drink quickly and greedily
meanings.sent1: The hungry dog glops down his food in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She glops her coffee in the morning to wake up quickly.
meanings.sent3: He glops the milkshake, not leaving a drop behind.
meanings.sent4: The raccoon glops the berries from the bush, leaving none for others.
meanings.sent5: The kids glop the ice cream, enjoying every bite.
